data.text:
call a special meeting of such holders of Preferred Stock at which such holders shall vote
as a single class for the election of the preferred stock directors. If such meeting shall
not have been called by the Board of Directors within said 30 day period, such meeting
may be called, upon like notice, at the expense of the Corporation, at any time thereafter
prior to the next annual meeting of stockholders or the termination of such default period,
by the holders of not less than 1% of the number of shares of Preferred Stock at that
was By-L ofhed by trerssquide i rekholng of socittee mlnnua aheng. If tndisa outtemit
the Corporation to be held within 60 days after the beginning of a default period, the
preferred stock directors shall be elected at the annual meeting of stockholders by such
holders of Preferred Stock voting as a single class. After the first election of preferre
stock directors, as herein provided, and as long as the default period continues, the pre-
ferred stock directors shall be elected annually by the holders of Preferred Stock
then entitled to elect preferred stock directors voting as a single class at the annual
meeting of stockholders.
For the election of preferred stock directors each holder of Preferred Stock shall be
entitled to as many votes as shall equal the number of shares of Preferred Stock held by
ach holder, multiplied by the number of preferred stock directors to be elected an
e may cast all of such votes for a single preferred stock director or may distribul
them among the number to be voted for or any tio or more of them as he may see fit.
All meetings at which the holders of both Preferred Stock and Common Stock shall
be entitled to vote shall be held as provided in the By-Laws of the Corporation. All other
meetings of the holders of Preferred Stock shall be hold at the place designated in the
By-Laws of the Corporation as the place for holding its annual meeting of stockholders.
The holders of shares of Preferred Stock entitled to be voted at such meeting shall be
he only stockholders of the Corporation entitled to reccive notice of and to vote at ans
special meeting of the holders of Preferred Stock. The holders of 35% of such shares ol
Preferred Stock then outstanding present in person or by proxy shall constitute a quorum;
provided, however, that in the absence of a quorum a majority of those holders of such
shares who are present in person or by proxy shall have the power to adjourn any such
meeting from time to time without notice other than announcement at the meeting, until
the holders of the requisite amount of such shares of Preferred Stock shall be present in
person or by proxy, but such adjournments shall not be made to a date beyond the date for
the mailing of notice of the next annual meeting of the stockholders of the Corporation
